content:
Diagnosis:	T1N0M0 high grade urothelial papillary carcinoma of bladder

Management:	12 Jan 2024 TURBT with complete resection
		15 Feb 2024 Started intravesical BCG therapy

Histology:	High grade papillary urothelial carcinoma, pT1, ERBB2 amplification positive

Current Situation:	Review during BCG induction therapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today during week 4 of BCG induction therapy. He has tolerated the treatment well with only mild local irritative symptoms lasting 24-48 hours after each instillation. No systemic symptoms or fever reported. Urinalysis today shows no evidence of infection. His most recent flexible cystoscopy on 15 March 2024 showed no visible recurrence. Blood tests remain stable with normal renal function.

He will complete the remaining 2 weeks of induction BCG therapy. We have arranged follow-up flexible cystoscopy in 6 weeks' time, followed by clinic review to discuss maintenance BCG schedule. He understands to contact us if developing fever or worsening urinary symptoms.
